name: here to help.
description:
here to help  is a faced paced, wave based, planet hopping shoot-em-up. You can't die, but your planets can. Defend the planets from the attacking Happy forces with your bullets, shield and a multitude of power ups. Can you protect all 3 worlds and survive to the end?

UNIVERSITY OF CHESTER PROJECT DETAILS

Here To Help was created for our first year Game Design Theory and Implementation module. Students are taught game theory and how to use a game engine (GameMaker: Studio) to create a short single player game.

CONTROLS

  • WASD to move around the planets
  • F to use the Planet Jumper
  • Left mouse button to shoot in direction of mouse cursor

REQUIREMENTS

  • Windows PC
  • Keyboard and Mouse

TEAM MEMBERS

  • 1 x Level 4 Student

COURSE DETAILS

The work presented here is that of our students. Although the page is run by the University of Chester, views in the games do not necessarily represent those of the University of Chester.

Information on the BSc Games Development course at University of Chester can be found here. 

Twitter: @UoCGamesDev
